intro: Parathesis adenanthera, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its large, showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces long, pendulous fruit pods that split open to release seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
